text:
Recently, I read a scientific paper about "how to tie shoes ?".
I want to talk about this topic because it's a usual but it's suprising about how we don't know about tie.
This paper take the classique tie on shoes and looks the effect of inertia of a walk on it.
They find, we do a bad tie every day on ours shoes and every step the tie became more and more lose.
That lead to make the tie again and again.
To undo that effect we need to make the loop of the second tie under the first one,
with this tie when you walk the tie is horizontal and every step press more and more the tie and the shoes.
You can reconize a bad and a good tie by the juste it's position.
For exemple a tie horizontal try to be more strong and a vertical tie try to be more and more week.
This physical phenomena is a great way to introduc the math filds of "tie theory" and in general about scientific paper.
I love this kind of paper is a great way to be curius about a many not to conplicated subject.
You can learn about every thing you want and you have acces to unlimited knowledg with internet.
You just need to find the interest of this type of subject and to read some complex and technical paper.
But it's very fun.
Alex Dupont
